title: ISic000028. I.Sicily inscription 000028
body:
Facsimile Images

Ti(berio) ((·)) Claudio ((·)) Herodi-
ano ((·)) c(larissimo) ((·)) v(iro) ((·)) leg(ato) ((·)) prov(inciae) ((·)) Si-
cil(iae) ((·)) iudici ((·)) rarissi-
mo ((·)) patrono ((·)) col(oniae)
5Panhormit(anorum) ((·)) princi-
pales ((·)) viri ((·)) ex ((·)) aere col-
lato d(ono) ((·)) d(ederunt)

Apparatus criticus

Text of IMusPalermo

English translation

To Tiberius Claudius Herodianus, a man of most illustrious fame (i.e. of senatorial class), most extraordinary judge, patron of the colony of Panhormitans. The foremost men (of the colony) gave (this monument) as a gift from communally collected coin.

commentary
